subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Why Silicon Valley Loves Buddhism
description: A quick, practical guide to Why Silicon Valley Loves Buddhism.

hook.text: Steve Jobs was a Zen Buddhist. Jack Dorsey meditates daily. Why does tech worship a 2,500-year-old religion?

buildup.text: Silicon Valley discovered Buddhism in the 1970s through the San Francisco counterculture. Zen simplicity fit tech.

discovery.text: Buddhism's focus on present-moment awareness and emptying the mind appeals to people drowning in information.

twist.text: Critics call it 'McMindfulness' â€” Buddhism stripped of compassion and used to boost productivity. Profit, not wisdom.

climax.text: Tech's Buddhism obsession reveals a paradox: building devices that distract us, then meditating to escape them.

punchline.text: Tech builds distraction, then meditates to escape it. The irony is rich.

quiz.question: Why is Buddhism popular in Silicon Valley?
options: Mindfulness and present-moment focus appeal to information-overloaded workers
